intro: Gibbaeum muirii, commonly known as the Muir's cushion plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its dense, low-growing rosettes of fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the spring and summer months, which are clustered in loose inflorescences. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs that help reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Gibbaeum muirii is well adapted to rocky, well-drained soils and can survive in harsh, coastal environments.
